about.title: About Me
paragraphs: I'm a highly creative, passionate person and an empathetic team player. My love of story telling & visual design make me a techsavvy artist, but I also harbour excellent communication skills.
I have a background in both front-facing customer service and administrative roles. My strength lies in my ability to stay calm under pressure and find unique solutions to tricky problems.
I pride myself in being a reliable, consistent source of positive energy, caffiene, and terrible puns.

items.title: CBRE
items.subtitle: Marketing Coordinator  •  Auckland  • 2017-now
attributes: Managed all commercial advertising for Auckland.
Designed content for and organised corperate events

items.title: Smith & Smith Glass
items.subtitle: CSR  •  Auckland  • 2015-2017
attributes: Responsible for delivering consistent Customer Delight. This involved a thorough understanding a wide range of administrative and computer based system to identify products and schedule bookings across over 30 Smith and Smith branches nationwide. It also requires extensive knowledge of products and systems used by technicians in the field.

items.title: Vinewood Motion Graphics
items.subtitle: Creative Artist  •  Auckland  • 2014-2015
attributes: As a freelance creative artist working under director Phil Brough, I helped him out with anything extra he needed. There was a decent amount of 3D work (for anything from TV adverts to short films), but also some admin work (organising project workflow), and design work. Most important, however, was keeping satisfactory caffiene levels in the office - in which I was more than happy to oblige!

items.title: All About Plumbing
items.subtitle: Customer Service Manager  •  Christchurch  • 2007-2008
attributes: Staff Management and Job Scheduling. They were specialists in drain laying and gas-fitting as well as general plumbers, so keeping the guys organised and their job schedules full was sometimes a challenge.
It was extremely busy, but very rewarding work.
